fields.title: 24HoZZT
fields.description: Files containing content created for "24 Hours of ZZT" contests where entrants had 24 hours to create a ZZT game adhering to a given topic.

fields.title: Action
fields.description: Files containing content with a strong focus on fighting enemies, usually with shooting being a primary means of attack.

fields.title: Adventure
fields.description: Files containing content in which protagonist(s) go on a journey to accomplish a goal.

fields.title: Advertisement
fields.description: Files containing previews for (then) unreleased ZZT worlds.

fields.title: Arcade
fields.description: Files containing content that generally involves trying to set a high score/fast time.

fields.title: Art
fields.description: Files containing content meant to be experienced more than played.

fields.title: Beta
fields.description: Files containing content that is generally feature complete, but not yet fully tested or publicly released (until now)

fields.title: BKZZT
fields.description: Files containing content created for "Blitzkrieg ZZT" contests where entrants typically had 30 minutes to 1 hour to create a ZZT game adhering to a given topic.

fields.title: Cameo
fields.description: Files containing content that prominently features members of the ZZT and/or adjacent communities as characters.

fields.title: Catalog
fields.description: Files containing content that provides overviews of other releases from the file's author and/or company.

fields.title: Cinema
fields.description: Files containing content that is meant to be watched more than it is to be played.

fields.title: Comedy
fields.description: Files containing content that is intended to make the player laugh. This genre is intended more for files that focus on humor as one of the more important aspects of itself. No promises that these files are funny now, or were even all that funny when they were brand new.

fields.title: Comic
fields.description: Files containing content presented in a format similar to a comic strip.

fields.title: Collaboration
fields.description: Files containing content where many authors worked together to create the finished product.

fields.title: Compilation
fields.description: Files containing multiple releases of one or more ZZT worlds bundled in a single package.

fields.title: Contest
fields.description: Files containing content created for a content. See 24HoZZT, BKZZT, Game Jam, Ludum Dare, and WoZZT genres for specific contests.

fields.title: Demo
fields.description: Files containing publicly released and incomplete content to promote an upcoming world before its completion.

fields.title: Dungeon
fields.description: Files containing content that typically involves traversing dungeons or dungeon-like environments.

fields.title: Edutainment
fields.description: Files containing content intended to be educational and entertaining.

fields.title: Engine
fields.description: Files containing content showcasing a unique type of gameplay via the use of ZZT's objects. This may be a full game, or a proof-of-concept demonstrating a single usage of the engine. Common types of engines such as shooters, platformers, RPGs, etc. have their own dedicated genres as well.

fields.title: Experimental
fields.description: Files containing content that is unconventional when compared to more typical files.

fields.title: Fangame
fields.description: Games which use characters and settings from other media. These may be conversions of non-ZZT games or wholly original works.

fields.title: Fantasy
fields.description: Games which make heavy use of fantasy themes, settings, and imagery.

fields.title: Fighting
fields.description: Games which involve opponents

fields.title: Font
fields.description: Files which contain custom fonts to be used for ZZT worlds. Not games which use fonts which are marked by having a detail of "Modified Graphics".

fields.title: Help
fields.description: Files containing content to help the user learn how to play or create things with ZZT.

fields.title: Horror
fields.description: Files containing content to make the user feel afraid.

fields.title: Incomplete
fields.description: Files which have been released in an incomplete state, typically due to the author's abandonment.

fields.title: Ludum Dare
fields.description: Files containing content created for the Ludum Dare game jam event. Entrants have either 48 or 72 hours to create a game adhering to a topic.

fields.title: Magazine
fields.description: Files containing content with a strong focus on text you would find in a (typically video game focused) magazine such as reviews, previews, and/or interviews with community members.

fields.title: Maze
fields.description: Files containing content in which players navigate labyrinthine environments.

fields.title: Minigame
fields.description: Files containing one or more smaller games, with each often taking place on a single board.

fields.title: Mod
fields.description: Files containing content that modifies existing content. This generally implies someone other than the original author performed the modification.

fields.title: Multiplayer
fields.description: Files containing content intended for multiple players to participate together.

fields.title: Music
fields.description: Files which use audio as a major component of their design.

fields.title: Mystery
fields.description: Files which contain something to be solved or discovered over the course of the world

fields.title: Official
fields.description: Files containing content that is officially part of ZZT, having been submitted to Epic and published in an Epic released compilation of ZZT worlds. This consists of official releases of ZZT, Super ZZT, Best of ZZT, and ZZT's Revenge.

fields.title: Other
fields.description: Files that don't really do "labels".

fields.title: Parody
fields.description: Files that parody a shared cultural reference.

fields.title: Platformer
fields.description: Files that are played from a side-view usually with the player or player-controller object moving from side-to-side and jumping

fields.title: Puzzle
fields.description: Files that contain content focused on utilizing logical skills to find solutions.

fields.title: Racing
fields.description: Files that contain content requiring a player to get from Point A to Point B in a finite amount of time

fields.title: Random
fields.description: Files that play differently every time or files that are deliberately absurd in nature.

fields.title: Remake
fields.description: Files that remake existing games, either converting non-ZZT worlds to ZZT worlds or by enhancing existing ZZT worlds.

fields.title: Registered
fields.description: Files which were distributed to registered users.

fields.title: Retro
fields.description: Files which deliberately use the aesthetics and design principles seen in older ZZT worlds.

fields.title: RPG
fields.description: Files that contain content with a focus on a character's story and character growth through new abilities/equipment. Typically uses some form of engine to provide turn based combat over ZZT's shooting mechanics.

fields.title: Sci-Fi
fields.description: Files that contain content which uses science fiction themes heavily.

fields.title: Shareware
fields.description: Files which requested some form of payment in order to receive a registered version. These files may sometimes have deliberately less content, or regular reminders to register not found in the registered version.

fields.title: Shooter
fields.description: Files that contain content focused primarily on shooting, typically done via some sort of vehicle rather than having the player shoot directly.

fields.title: Simulation
fields.description: Files which contain content that attempts to simulate an activity.

fields.title: Space
fields.description: Files which contain content taking place in outer space.

fields.title: Sports
fields.description: Files which contain content based on sports.

fields.title: Story
fields.description: Files whose focus is on the story rather than the gameplay.

fields.title: Strategy
fields.description: Files that contain content in which the player oversees decisions that impact the results of a confrontation between rival factions.

fields.title: Toolkit
fields.description: Files which contain toolkits, one or more boards of elements in colors not normally accessible in ZZT's default editor. These have fallen out of use in favor of external editors that provide full access to all colors and elements ZZT supports.

fields.title: Trippy
fields.description: Files which contain content that tends to be surreal or dream-like. Does not inherently indicate drug use, but may.

fields.title: Trivia
fields.description: Files which contain content designed to quiz the player on one or more topics.

fields.title: Update
fields.description: Files which contain an updated release of a previously released file.

fields.title: Utility
fields.description: Files which contain tools to aid in creating ZZT worlds.

fields.title: WoZZT
fields.description: Files containing worlds created for "Weekend of ZZT" contests where entrants typically had 48 or 72 hours to create a ZZT game adhering to a given topic

fields.title: Oktrollberfest
fields.description: Files containing content created for the Oktrollberfest game jam event.
